Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: TravelToad12
Reviews.Content: First off, the front desk girl was friendly and accomodating, the only good thing about this hotel. Dirty. Very dirty. Elevators worked only randomly and the walk up the stairs was not in any way pleasant. Disgusting mouse droppings seemed to be everywhere, even on the balcony off the room. Spent one very uncomfortable night! Need a ethernet cord for internet, which thankfully I travel with. The building/buildings were previously assisted living apartments and still smell as such. Rooms were in shabby condition, although the bathroom countertops must have been recently replaced. Housekeeping deplorable. Go elsewhere for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Lowest point of our trip to Florida”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Duckky
Reviews.Content: Long story short, do NOT stay at this hotel. This is more like a bad extended stay Hostel, not a 3 star Hotel! Dirty and unsafe! Had the unfortunate experience of staying at this place one night during our trip to Miami: - The lifts are in very shabby condition. Broken and stinking. - The room was dirty. Found a dead cockroach under the bed and furniture was disgusting. - Weird characters frequented the hotel - Woke up in the morning to see people making out at the swimming pool - Another man telling the front desk to make sure the charge for the room should not appear on his credit card (read what you will from this) - The automatic entry door to the building stopped working from the outside (the sensor or something) and I had to wait for some people from the inside to come which opened the door. - I am a guy and did not feel safe at all! And the thing is I am not picky and have stayed at 1 stars that felt better and safer!

Reviews.Title: “The 2 Large Signs to the hotel state:Bed and Breakfast. The bed is included!”
Reviews.Author: notmuchifnotDutch
Reviews.Content: I have totally mixed feelings. When I arrived I was grreted very cordially. The 2 main areas of the hotel are poorly lit and parking late at night near the buildings is difficult to find.There are plenty of parking spaces if you do not mind walking.The web site states wi-fi for a fee. No wi-fi except in the lobby and that is free.I did get the last ethernet cord so I was able to be on the internet. There is no charge. Bring your own cord.The Bed and breakfast signs are ridiculous;Kendall's Finest Bed and Breakfast they state. Breakfast starts at 7 and when I arrived they asked me for my room number.After I got my plate I was told $12.95 plus taxes and tip. Plate returned. Parts of the building (Egret) seem like a 3 star hotel This once was a Crone Plaza.The elevator buttons all seem like someone took a hammer to them.My room was very large with a sofa and it was clean. The personnel were very nice. Housekeeping a plus. There is no microwave and if you want torefrigerate anything, you must get a $1.00 key. Lose it and $300 fee.I sppose they are afraid you will break into the room later and get the mini bar. I got my key and put it in the safe.This should be rated a 1.5 or 2 star hotel.2 phones, neither worked except to get the desk. Lines tied up was answer.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay with family and also good for seniors tour groups”
Reviews.Author: Cassandra902
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this property with my sister in law for a couple of days before going on a cruise out of Miami Port. Great location if you have a car and want to explore different attractions in the area. Reasonably priced with a nice pool and tennis courts for kids and adults. The staff were friendly and very helpful to us. If you want to tour without having to drive yourself the hotel has an excellent family run transportation service called careexpress transportation owned by Ernesto Llorens who will take you anywhere you want to go in Miami at a negotiated flat rate. We enjoyed our stay here and would go back again if we are going on a cruise out of Miami. Cassandra and Florence

Reviews.Title: “Poor condo conversion meets poor amenities...”
Reviews.Author: tcs03d
Reviews.Content: Short story: -Large rooms full of dirty furniture -4 story ex-condo buildings with broken elevators -No comp. internet, comp. breakfast, fuzzy cable, and a less than pathetic workout room Long story: Won this gem in Hotwire or Priceline. $75 a night for a 3 star. Ya, it was too good to be true. First impression, it looks good with decent grounds and lobby. Then I was put in a room on the fourth floor of a building that appears to be previously used as a condo with no working elevator. Room is larger than a typical hotel room, because they removed the kitchen. Other rooms have kitchens as I can tell through open windows and shades. In the room, the furniture is dirty, the internet has no signal and isn't included, tv reception is fuzzy, and breakfast is not included in the morning. Checked out the gym, but the 3 broken pieces of equipment from the 70's isn't worth a tetanus shot to workout on. I'm here on business, so my priorities are different than some. The pool does look clean and the tennis courts are in good shape. This could be an affordable place for someone else to stay if they wanted to be in the Kendall area. Honestly, check out the Best Western 3 miles west with its free internet, breakfast, and gym pass to the adjacent LA Fitness.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you are traveling with a large group”
Reviews.Author: samanthal_15
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel after traveling 12 hours overnight and were definitely hoping for an early check in. I had called twice before to request an early check in and was told the usual that if a room was available then we could get in. When we arrived it was about 9am and I approached the front desk and asked to check in and the woman just looked at me and said "check in is not til 3." We ended up being able to get in early but in a different building than the rest of the people that were in town for the same wedding. We stayed in the heron building at the hotel. The elevator was iffy at best, we made comments about how scary it was on our way to the 4th floor with all of our bags and when we came out of our hotel room later there was a sign on it that it was broken. When we got to our room it was completely unlocked and left open from the cleaning people which is always sketchy. We had a two bedroom suite and it was very spacious. The furniture is pretty old and the TV has a sticker on it talking about having a tracking device if you try to steal it. The beds were comfortable enough and the couch folded out to be a 3rd bed. About half the power outlets in the room did not work. The second bathroom had the usual toiletries except for they were already half gone. The room cleaning was poor. The air conditioning unit was horribly noisy in the second bedroom making it hard to sleep. There is almost a full kitchen which is nice that you do not have to eat out. There is no microwave so you cannot reheat most food that you do bring home. There was a sign for ice machines on the 1 & 3rd floor and neither of them worked. When we called the front desk expecting them to bring ice they stated the one on the 2nd floor should be working. I went to check out at the front desk just to make sure all the charges were correct and there was only one person working the front desk around noon so after waiting in like for 15 minutes I simply walked out. We did not have a great experience at this hotel but it gets the job done. Its definitely affordable if you are traveling with a large group with the option of the 2 bedroom suite. We will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good option depending on what you are doing”
Reviews.Author: prs2007
Reviews.Content: I was spending 2 nights in the area and booked this hotel because of the larger rooms and proximity to local shopping. There is a large mall nearby and lots of chain restaurants. It is among a couple of hospitals and a good option if you need a place to stay while visiting someone at those facilities. The grounds are run down some and landscaping needs some attention, but for a basic hotel it is fine. It is not a lobby based hotel. Each building has a key access entry. It doesn't feel the safest so stay alert.

Reviews.Title: “Decent 2-bedrom suite, will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Yatur
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite for 6 nights: 2 adults and 2 children. This accommodation had everything we needed and then some: 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, huge living room, a refrigerator, a range, and a microwave (for $5/day extra). So, we were able to save a lot of money by buying food in local supermarkets and having breakfast and suppers in the suite. Many people say the hotel is run down. I did not notice much of the decay, but I am not especially picky. Granted, this is no Marriott or Sheraton, but you get what you're paying for. The beds were clean, the stuff was friendly, albeit many workers had limited English. People at the front desk answer the phone immediately and speak perfect English. At one point I phoned the front desk and requested additional coffee packs (oh, yeah, the suite also has a coffee machine). They were brought to me within 10 minutes, at no charge. The pool was somewhat far from our apartment, about 5 minutes walk, but the good thing is that it is open until 11PM at night. The property has plenty of parking: I was always able to park within 30 feet of the entrance. The area felt safe and quiet at night. The location is good for excursions around South Miami, the Everglades and upper Keys: about an hour one way to Key Largo and Shark Valley, about 2 hours to Flamingo visitor center. Bottom line: this hotel has decent quality for the money. Will stay there again if I am in the area with the family.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Nigel E
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the hotel three times in the last year. The bed and breakfast rate is hard to beat and though it is not a luxury property it is value for the rate. We use the hotel for visits to the Baptist Hospital right next door which is very convenient. we rent a car and find it easy to get around to shops and nearby Dadeland Mall. For a leisure trip we would stay out by the beach but for practicality, access to Kendall area and hospital it is ideal for us. The rooms are huge and were not originally designed for pure hotel use, I think, hence they are much larger. There are some areas of the hotel that could do with upkeep but the general feel of the property is quite acceptable

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the plague”
Reviews.Author: LindaMilan
Reviews.Content: The service is poor and the hotel is not clean. It looks very run down with marks on the wall, old paint. Very deteriorated. Just last month (September 2011) I made a reservation for three family members. The staff did not treat them with respect. We complained to management and they promised a discount that never became a reality. A month later (October 2011) another family member decided to stay against my recommendation. Besides the sloppy appearance of the property, the roof leaked on his room on day two of this visit. This happened in the morning.The carpet was very wet. Well, they told him simply that he had to wait until 3PM to see if a room was available. Not until 4PM did they told us upon asking that a room was available. He moved. I asked for a discount for the inconvenience and they told me to come the next day to speak to the manager. The manager refused to offer a discount for the first 20 minutes. She later said she could reduce the rate $20 dollars only. The other issue of the hotel is the breakfast. During both visits multiple guests questioned if breakfast was included since the hotel give you the appearance it is always included. Well that is not the case, the breakfast is included for the $99 plus fares. Do not stay. Consider instead Hotel Indigo about 1.5 aways or a hotel in the Dadeland area.

Reviews.Title: “This place was absolutely disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: none of u
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for a few months while our home was being renovated. During our stay: our sink stopped working. the roof leaked in several rooms (we had a two bed room suite) causing damage to many of our belongings (which the hotel did not offer to replace or event fix the problem). the walls had stains all over them. we constantly received dirty sheets when the maids would supposedly give us fresh ones (once i found blood stains on our "fresh sheets." the breakfast was good but often the fruit would be spoiled because it was left out and the bread had flies all over it. The maids were rude and would talk about us while we were in the room! (I guess they thought i didn't know spanish). This hotel has a roach problem as well as bed bugs! Also, although this hotel is located in a good area, many of it's guests are people of questionable morals. (quite frankly, I witnessed several instances where men would come with a female "guest." Personally I could care less but I would not want my ... My family and I stayed here while our home was being renovated. During our stay: our sink stopped working. the roof leaked in several rooms (we had a two bed room suite) causing damage to many of our belongings (which the hotel did not offer to replace or event fix the problem). the walls had stains all over them. we constantly received dirty sheets when the maids would supposedly give us fresh ones (once i found blood stains on our "fresh sheets." the breakfast was good but often the fruit would be spoiled because it was left out and the bread had flies all over it. The maids were rude and would talk about us while we were in the room! (I guess they thought i didn't know spanish). This hotel has a roach problem as well as bed bugs! Also, although this hotel is located in a good area, many of it's guests are people of questionable morals. (quite frankly, I witnessed several instances where men would come with a female "guest." Personally I could care less but I would not want my kids seeing this sort of thing). I'm from this area so I know that many of the local youth throw parties here (as I once did). This is no big deal unless you actually enjoy a full night's rest. The pool couldn't be dirtier. (I actually saw poop sitting at the bottom of the shallow end once). The gym machines are usually broken. The front desk staff are slow and incompetent. Lastly, there is no washer and drier. This is more of an inconvenience than a grievance. Anyways, this was a horrible experience. I never usually write these sort of things but this was so bad I just don't want anyone to go through what we went through. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Jewl”
Reviews.Author: KeyWestDave
Reviews.Content: I live in key west and was going in for a treatment at baptist hospital and I ran into this hotel by mistake. The hotel is right next to the Baptist Hospital. I was going to drive to the Marriott at Dadeland but went to check inside and was pleasantly surprised. The Lobby was nice and had a beautiful salt water fish tank. They let me look at room with a king bed and was much larger than a average hotel room. I ended up staying for three days. The breakfast was great at reasonable price of 12 dollars and the dinner was great too. All the staff was friendly and the customer service was great. This is a great option in a key location. I would recommend this hotel for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “keep looking”
Reviews.Author: jackie h
Reviews.Content: Same as above stayed for location purposes. I will not stay again for the price you can do a whole lot better !!!!! There were bugs crawling across floor but thank goodness that was on checkout day !!!!! Very outdated !!!!! outside looks good so maybe they need to pay attention to inside now !!!! Also had a french fry that remained in my room in the same place for 2 days even after the maid had cleaned it twice !!!!!! food was way over priced and was less than average in taste. shop around i have found really good deals that are just as good location wise!!!!! I travel to Miami once a month..... I should probably start my own blog on where to stay and where NOT to stay !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Kendall Hotel & Suites, Kendall, FL”
Reviews.Author: macpanther03
Reviews.Content: We went to Kendall to visit our friends who live 10 minutes away from the hotel. The hotel met its purpose for us which was just to sleep, shower and change. We spent all day out doing things. This is not a resort/vacation destination in my opinion; nevertheless, we found it to be comfortable and clean. It's definitely a bit outdated and in need of some repairs (one of the elevators was out of service for at least 4 days; we used the other one without a problem), but the grounds were neatly kept, the staff was friendly to us, and we were overall comfortable. We didn't eat at the hotel so we can't comment on the breakfast/lunch/dinner that was offered. Again, we were happy that it served its purpose. We would definitely stay there again in a similar situation.

Reviews.Title: “Bad news”
Reviews.Author: Chas f
Reviews.Content: Awful, use to be a good hotel but now it is terrible. No management, bad attitudes and stinks. Stayed on business with Baptist Hospital but now I will go elsewhere. Anywhere will be better. And I was warned by a Baptist employee before hand too, my bad.

Reviews.Title: “Kendall Hotel an outstanding value”
Reviews.Author: bsa819
Reviews.Content: We again enjoyed our stay at the Kendall Hotel and Suites where we frequently stay when visiting family in Miami. The rooms are very comfortable and large with fabulous beds and if you want a home-away-from-home experience, the suites are fantastic. The low prices include a great breakfast and there is a quiet and nicely landscaped outdoor pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Great place with good value”
Reviews.Author: travelwith3
Reviews.Content: We were more than happy with the Kendall Hotel and Suites. We traveled with 2 little boys and the accommodations were perfect, a nice master suite and a separate bedroom with a pullout sofa. It was quiet and there was a full sized kitchen. The food in the restaurant was not bad- not great- but definitely not bad. The room price is totally reasonable considering all the amenities involved. Reception was very professional and the room was very clean. The only problem we had was that we needed a cable to use the free internet. We didn't bring our own so we had to borrow one from reception (they only had 2 so we had to wait quite a while for one). We would definitely stay there again when in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Trip To Miami I Will Never Forget :D”
Reviews.Author: epicness
Reviews.Content: I had an amazing trip with my family. The rooms were fully equipted with everything you need, the kitchen didnt have a microwave. The staff were VERY friendly, there was a worker named Bagdan he informed me about everything, very friendly. The housekeeping was on time and cleaned everything after us. There is a lovely pool and the water is just fine. The fitness room included towels, a T.V, free water, and different tpes of equiptment. The whole place was very clean and well kept. You could order food down at the bar. The breakfast was very good. From potatoes, waffles, eggs, to varios of drinks and beverages. The beach was only a few miles away, and Key West two hours away. I hope I have a chance to come again next year.

Reviews.Title: “nice setup, but 2 star customer service, cleanliness and hotel condition”
Reviews.Author: Kay-India
Reviews.Content: How can I put thisâ€¦The experience I had at this hotel was pretty poor, if not average. The value and amenities were decent, but the hotel itself is in poor condition. The one staff at the front desk was very helpful, and attentive (one of the reasons it has 3 stars)â€¦very good customer service skills, all of what the other female at the front desk lacked. As you enter the lobby, you get the feeling youâ€™re in a 4 star hotel. The design is unique; it features a garden like landscape inside the hotel with the rooms surrounding it. They also have elevators, which appears to be a death trapâ€¦buttons are missing and or broken. I took the stairs, which was difficult, because I had luggages. I must say the setup of the room was nice, it had a small living room area w/snack cabinet, dining area, large bed, nice size bathroom and kitchen, also televisions, but once I got settled, I started to notice the lack of cleanliness. I use to work in a hotel, and held multiple positions, one being a housekeeper. If the room I stayed in was inspected, it would fail. I checked the mattress for bed bugs (none); I checked the bedding, which had multiple hairs on the pillows, a significant amount of dust underneath them and on the head of the mattress. It seemed like someone previously slept on the bed, and housekeepers decided not to change the bedding, in other words, remaking it since it didnâ€™t look â€œtoo dirtyâ€� (a lot of housekeepers do that to save time). I slept at the foot of the bed and on top the sheets (I was that disgusted). The soap in the dish tray, used to wash hands, was unwrapped and dirty, the towels had hairs, the sink had scum and hairs (I brushed my teeth and cleansed my face in the shower). Later on I ordered room service and a kitchen staff brought it to my door, without announcing herself. I tried telling her I wanted to pay using a different card or cash, but she quickly rejected that idea, because she "would have had to come back"....basically she did not want to do it (I still gave her a small tip). The breakfast was good, and I felt somewhat relieved that I was checking out that morning. In a nutshell, it was okay, but they need a better staff (cust/ser. skills), they need to fix damages in the hotel, and they need to inspect rooms. If youâ€™re staying for a few hours (like myself) or just a day, and donâ€™t mind any of it, then be my guest, but if youâ€™re planning to stay in the area longer, then I suggest trying somewhere else. To some, this is would not be a "deal breaker", but I'm a very clean person. Not every hotel can be perfect, but come on, you can do better than that. On a scale to 10, I would give the amenities a 7, the staff and the condition of the building/room need to catch up, and then other hotels will be in for some competition. I have a pic or two of the room, but not of what I found to be disturbing.

Reviews.Title: “I really like this place.”
Reviews.Author: johnelga
Reviews.Content: I have had mixed results with motels in Florida over the years. This was a good choice. The facility is older, but it is well maintained. The room was great. It was very large. It was "L shaped" with a small dining table a sofa and a nice king sized bed. The bathroom was nice sized also. And even more important, it was clean. Hot water? There was a hot water heater in the bathroom closet. Yep, the bathroom had a closet. There was plenty of hot water. The grounds were nice and maintained well. One night we were bushed and we wanted to get a drink without starting the car. We went to the bar on the property. It was a very nice facility, and the service was great, and quiet. The next night we debated going out for supper. We ate at the motel and it was very good. The tennis court and pool were nice and right next to the restaurant. The neighborhood was great! The motel is part of a campus for a hospital. Lots of folks walking and jogging around the ponds in front of the hospital. Shopping is right down the road. When were walking around the property we ran into the security guard every time. The adjoining neighborhood is made up of nice homes. We felt safe. Keep in mind that this facility is not next to the beach. If you look hard, you can find some signs of aging but not in your room or the restaurant. It's a nice place with nice people working there. I told the manager when I was checking out, "Try as I may, I couldn't find anything to complain about."

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay, best sleep ever!”
Reviews.Author: BrittanieW
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff wasn't the easiest to understand and they had trouble understanding us sometimes, but the rooms were huge and perfectly clean, the beds were amazingly comfortable, the amenities were great except the hot tub was 'broken' which is typical of hotels/apartments in Miami. Pretty garden thing in between the buildings, could use some chairs down there, but it's really nice, air blows through the buildings and makes it really comfortable and relaxing. Looks outside are deceiving, definitely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Intimate, Quiet, Relaxing -- all at a great rate!”
Reviews.Author: Wordsmith23
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I loved our 2-night stay at this Kendall property. One of the things I enjoyed most about it was the intimate feel. Even though there were a few kids on the premises -- the hotel, I noticed, is already offering summer camp activities -- the atmosphere remained quiet and relaxing throughout our entire stay. Sometimes it felt as if we had the entire property to ourselves. We enjoyed sunbathing poolside; however, when it came time to go for a dip in the pool, we nearly froze our buns off! Granted, it was fairly breezy outside, but I'm sure the hotel can do a better job of regulating the temperature of the water. I enjoyed the fact that the pool area was nearly empty -- only 2-3 people were there with us on both days. The room was, for the most part, clean and comfortable. I noticed a curtain stain upon arrival, but no biggie. Also, it would have been nice to have a view of the pool from the balcony, but instead we had to settle for that of the parking lot. The bathroom was huge, which is always a plus. We also raved about the bar/restaurant, which was modern in appearance and had a cozy, relaxed feel to it. We paid the bed and breakfast rate and wound up feeling glad we did -- it includes everything from delicious bacon and sausage to bagels to scrambled eggs and cereals. The restaurant also serves delicious -- and moderately priced -- food for dinner. The menu is somewhat limited but that's to be expected when you're at a small hotel. We ate there the first night and just had to go back the next day. I recommend the Churrasco steak and American burger! And I can't say enough about the service; the staff was very polite all throughout. The hotel is near a host of shops and restaurants. I'd definitely recommend Kendall Hotel and Suites -- obviously not for a romantic/honeymoon getaway, but it is definitely worth a shot if you're interested in a short and relaxing stay in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Not so nice.....”
Reviews.Author: pilot2643
Reviews.Content: Once upon a time, you can tell this was a nice hotel. Not so nice any more. I would like to be fair in this review, but the place just looks like a worn out former chain property that was sold to a private buyer. It appears to cater to "extended stay" folks in need of a dry room for a low price. Lots of repair trucks, service vehicles etc. tucked away in the back, with an empty parking lot up front. All my wife had to see was the pick up truck parked half on the sidewalk and hanging over the curb (like a drunk had badly parked), the huge stick-on label affixed to the front of the TV that reads "equipped with GPS anti-theft device" and a few of our fellow "guests" and we realized we would be sleeping with our eyes open tonight. We checked out. Wish the experience could have been more positive.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean value for the price.”
Reviews.Author: SodusBay
Reviews.Content: I was a little taken aback when the first thing I noticed when I walked in the room was a table (by the door) that had some sort of hole in it which had been globbily patched with plastic wood, but once I got past that, I found my room to be clean and comfortable. This is a metaphor for the whole place, in that there are little minor but noticeable frays here and there around the edges of the physical plant, but no big deal, just minor foibles. Overall, and especially for the money, it's a nice, neat, clean, excellent-value place to stay. It's also a little different that the usual cookie-cutter hotel. This hotel consists of a number of free-standing buildings with open atriums, so it has kind of a "campus" feel. Don't expect a view, but the grounds are nice, with jogging paths and nicely landscaped green spaces nearby, because this facility is actually located in and at the edge of the Baptist Hospital complex. This location is convenient to 826, the Turnpike, and U.S. 1, and a good place from which to "pop" into Miami (depending on the time of day as to whether Miami traffic will allow "popping"), amble over to nearby Dadeland or South Miami, or access the deeper Southwest suburbs and sites, such as the Zoo, the Rail Museum, the Redlands, Everglades, & etc. The staff was courteous and helpful, the maid service was diligent and effective, and the pool, bar, and lobby were very nice. This is definitely NOT a beach hotel. It's not a glitzy hotel. It's not the place to indulge your lover or new bride in a romantic getaway, but if you need a clean, decent place to bivouac while visiting the Kendall area, this is a darn good place. I'll stay there again. One ODD note: This facility offers ONLY WIRED internet access IN THE ROOM(s). They have wireLESS internet access ONLY in the lobby / bar. SO, if you"re bringing a laptop, bring an (RJ-45) ethernet cable. If you want to use it in bed or on the couch, bring a LONG cable, and if you want to use your ipad or wireless-only device, bring your own wireless access point (or plan on spending a lot of time in the lobby / bar).

Reviews.Title: “Wow! I was really impressed!”
Reviews.Author: alisonvenzen
Reviews.Content: I was truly impressed with my room. The room was bigger then i expected, VERY clean and beautifully decorated. I would def stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great room....”
Reviews.Author: Lifesaverstore
Reviews.Content: Great service hope to see you again next year! The resturant served good food but the service was slow. Great room and great views.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find in South Miami”
Reviews.Author: clrWashngton_DC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely resort by itself. It is also located across the street from Miami's Baptist Hospital which helps contribute to campus like setting. Dinner in the hotel restaurant is real bargain: most items are between $10 and $14. The pizza (16 inches) at $9.95 is all that you could want. You can get it in a take-out box (slight service charge). Even the mini-bar is reasonable priced. Rooms are big and clean. The furniture may be a little worn (most dings in wooden pieces). The room has wired high speed internet (approximately 3mbps)..

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant and clean”
Reviews.Author: butchermarie
Reviews.Content: We read the previous reviews and decided to just make our own decision, since the hotel is only 10 minutes from our daughter's home and that was the purpose of our trip. The room was very clean -- we had a king non-smoking. There was a love seat and coffee table in front of a large flat screen TV and a small "kitchenette area." The bed was extremely comfortable, and the bathroom was spacious with hot water throughout our two showers (each room apparently has its own hot water tank). The only downside of the room was that the housekeepers were a tad "pushy" -- they knocked on our door to clean our room twice within an hour (before 9 a.m.) on one day, and the number of hand towels was sporadic from day to day. This in no way means we did not have enough towels, just that one day there were 4 hand towels, another day there was only one, most days there were 2. We chose the "bed and breakfast" rate which incuded a breakfast buffet of spicy homefry potatos, scrambled eggs, pancakes, bacon, sausage links, fresh fruit, assorted pastries and breads to toast, made-to-order omelettes, coffee, juice, tea. The food was warm and tasty. The dining room staff was very friendly, as was the front desk staff. I definitely will re-visit this hotel on another trip to the area to visit our daughter. I might add that if you need to be a patient or be near a patient of the Baptist Children's Hospital, this hotel is within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby and dirty”
Reviews.Author: blond06
Reviews.Content: This was a very sad, rundown hotel. In the bathroom, there was dirt on the soap package and soap dish, and strange brownish stains in the shower. Also, the bathroom had no ventilation fan, so when you showered you nearly suffocated. There were light bulbs missing in half the lights. The elevator certificate was out of date and it never displayed the correct floor. The TV was gone from the TV cabinet. The bedroom had a filthy ceiling corner by the vent that my eyes kept getting drawn to. The hot tub had no water in it, an even greater shame because the pool was too cold to swim in. One day the staff didn't replenish the coffee packages. The balcony doors had no screens so we were forced to have AC even though the weather was pleasant outside. The kitchen had old appliances and old countertops. It may be cheap but it was not fun.

Reviews.Title: “I was pleasantly surprised. A bargin ,very nice.”
Reviews.Author: slick33040
Reviews.Content: Very clean roomy and quiet.The lady at the front desk could not have be nicer and helpful. I lost her card. She was great.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: tlkr
Reviews.Content: I was hoping to spend less on a hotel in Kendall, but couldn't find a cheaper hotel. So I booked the Kendall because it was the closest to my destination. It was actually quite good for the money. The room was very large, with a large couch, TV unit, and desk. The bathroom was large too. Everything was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: acatri
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Kendall hotel and suites during my trip to Miami, in August 2010, due to the proximity to my friendsâ€™ house. It looks like it probably serves a certain niche of travelers, rather than vacationers, but in anyways I was impressed with the hospitality and genuine kindness of the staff. I am not used with servants. So, I was very touched one morning when I returned from a brief breakfast, to find that the housekeeper made sure to fix my room + bathroom while I was out. I was surprise to find that along with the standard clean up she also rearranged tidy and neat all my belonging in a very â€œhome design magazineâ€� style, especially the toiletries. Some other great amenities of this property are the pool area, the continental breakfast, and obviously the 24/7 computer room.

Reviews.Title: “Next door to Baptist Hospital.”
Reviews.Author: FlightMedicOne
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed twice here due to long hospital stays, both in 2004 and 2010. We live in the Florida Keys and have had some acute medical events that required stays near the hospital. The staff is nice and anything asked for was provided promptly. They put out a nice breakfast every morning which helps. The pool is just fine for the kids, but needs a bit more shade. We have no complaints and would stay again, God forbid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: NMD72
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable accommodations. Only thing I would suggest is that a television be put in the other bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Just amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Bigfishsaab
Reviews.Content: Coming from the northeast, and living in South Florida for a little over 9 years. The initial hospitality from the front desk personnel was outstanding. Felt welcomed at all times, and the rooms were impeccable. I recommend this place to everyone I've talkesd to since I was there last week. Very nice place..

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, spacious, elegant hotel with friendly, welcoming staff and lovely gardens and grounds”
Reviews.Author: greenparrotToronto
Reviews.Content: The Kendall Hotel is an architecturally beautifully designed hotel. The rooms are spacious and elegantly appointed and each has a private balcony overlooking the gardens and swimming pool or quiet grounds with palm trees. I enjoyed walking in the spacious green grounds every morning and relaxing under the large trees. There were also tennis courts and shuffleboard. The staff was welcoming and friendly and the breakfast buffet included homemade omelets, fresh yogurt and fruit, lovely coffee, pastries, and almost everything else one could think of. One could have breakfast inside in a pretty cafe or outside on the patio with a woodpecker or a small flock of green parrots passing by in the trees not far away. I would highly recommend the Kendall Hotel and I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel at a very good price”
Reviews.Author: deputydan57
Reviews.Content: I'd stay there again, which says it all. The only thing I'd want extra is a hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Value”
Reviews.Author: mrgrocery
Reviews.Content: The Kendall Hotel and Suites may not be the newest or fanciest hotel but it was a great hotel for our extended stay. 6 of us stayed in a 2 bedroom unit and there was more than enough room for us. The suite had a small kitchen(bigger than some of the appartments I lived in) and even had a dishwasher (Dishes too). My only complaint about the kitchen was no microwave but that is a minor inconvenience. The suite had 2 tv's with more channels than a vacationer needs. It was clean and the staff were great. The location was great for us with lots of services close by and close to many of the major roads we needed to access. We would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely roomy, comfortable and relaxed environment”
Reviews.Author: ClassyLady221
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. It was a very pleasant experience. The rooms are incredibly large and have a balcony. The free breakfast was awesome. You can't beat the price.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was wonderful. We stayed here in December 2009 and that is why we came back.”
Reviews.Author: november1101
Reviews.Content: You have a wonderful hotel. Very comfortable, a great staff, the surroundings are beautiful. We will never stay in another hotel when we travel to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service & management”
Reviews.Author: hask1
Reviews.Content: We were part of a small group of 22 that stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, 3 days. The hotel is very nice with spacious, clean rooms and a very nice complimentary breakfast BUT the service is abominable. It was difficult to make a reservation over the phone. No-one picked up. Phone service within the hotel was awful. Dinner at the hotel restaurant was a total disaster. The carpet in one suite was soaked (probably from the A/C). Changing the room took hours and the room offered was dirty, not made up and didn't have a TV, radio or luggage stand. The management was never available and seemed to be in hiding. I was very embarrassed as a leader of this group as members of my group were not happy. This is not a hotel we would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “needs maintenance”
Reviews.Author: islandmom3
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times because it is right next to Baptist Hospital. I have never had a room where everything works. Once the AC leaked and the carpet was soaking wet, the clock radios never are set probably and the time is always wrong, the phone did not work one time and there are NEVER luggage carts available. I stay there because it's close to the hospital but that is the only reason. It is not overly clean nor overly well maintained and always short staffed. They need to upgrade and spend some money on the facility.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveler048
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel and I will never stay here again, nor will I ever recommend this hotel to anyone. I booked my hotel through Priceline and didn't have the option to choose what bed type I wanted, so when I arrived to the hotel I was given a room with a King bed. I went to the lobby and spoke to the attendant and asked if he could change me to room with two double beds. He informedme that I would need to call Priceline to get this taken care of, which I did, but since it was 1:30 in the morning no one at Priceline could help me, so I went back to the lobby and asked the attndany if he could help me out. He told me that Ishould have chosen the bed type when I made the reservation, I told him I didn't have the option and he pretty much called me a liar and walked away from me while I was speaking to him. I travel a lot for business and I am sure of one thing, I will never stay here again! They really should find some employees that know how to speak to the customers and know how to treat their customers!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good alternative”
Reviews.Author: Benguin
Reviews.Content: We got a 2-bedroom suite with kitchen. The suite was clean, nicely decorated. The only thing that stood out was our kitchen - probably never remodeled, without a microwave but with broken dishwasher. The rooms were big enough to stay there comfortably. The second bedroom was missign a TV, not a bog deal. In addition, I expected to have a DVD player in the room... The staff was nice and friendly. Housekeeping did a good job. Complimentary breakfast was very good. Free WiFi was only avaialble in the restaurant. Hotel ran out of network cables to get a connection in the room. That's pretty sad, how cheap can they be? To sum up, you get what you paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, spacious, good service and excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: pdxoldgal
Reviews.Content: Housekeeping was very good, beds were excellent, rooms were spacious , price was very reasonable and included a hot breakfast. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff was friendly but the facility needed maintenance and to be more traveler friendly”
Reviews.Author: MadisonMac
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Kendall Hotel and Suites began with a long slow line to check-in, only 1 person was on duty. Once we did get our key we found out it did not work in the room we were assigned. We were assigned a different room but when we came back to our room later that night the key did not work. We went to the front desk and they told us they would extend our stay but we told them we just checked in 7 hours ago. When they asked us to verify our name the room was not even in our name. We did get our key but having key issues twice within in a short period of time is crazy since it is a big facility and the front desk is quite a distance from our room. The hotel was in need of maintenance such as the elevator door only opened partially (maybe 4 inches) so you had to force it open with your hand, the window shade in our room was broken and the patio door handle was broken as well. The hotel did not have any vending machines on site so if you wanted anything to eat or drink before the bar area opened at 4:00 pm you had to travel off site. I would expect some of these inconveniences in cheap hotel but we were paying $190 per night. I would not recommend this hotel and will not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, wonderful complimentary breakfast, spacious rooms- very comfortable stay overall”
Reviews.Author: sunflowerFlorida
Reviews.Content: I had a very positive experience staying at this hotel as a patient at Baptist Hospital. The staff was very accommodating, warm, friendly and gracious. The rooms were spacious, clean with plenty of light. I've stayed at many hotels and some four star resorts but the Kendall Hotel was more comfortable and more affordable, particularly for extended stay living arrangements. I enjoyed the complimentary hot breakfast and the evening happy hour- a very pleasant experience overall!

Reviews.Title: “I couldnt ask for a better place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: julieleblanc13
Reviews.Content: This is by far a great place!!!! When i booked the trip i wasent sure what to expect after researching Miami hotels (most were pretty scary), but when my husband and i got to the hotel we were so excited!!! These were some of the biggest rooms we have ever stayed in!! Everything was perfect...the staff was extreamly nice, the rooms were nice, very clean, very comfy and big! Oh and may i add that the "contentinal breakfast" was not what you typically get (muffin and coffee), this was a buffet, of HOT breakast (breakfast potatos, bacon, pancakes, bagels, toast, yogurt, pastries and an OMLET STATION!) And this is all included in the $99/night price!!! I highly recommend staying here if you are ever in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Suited our needs just fine, thank you.”
Reviews.Author: waltersmomma
Reviews.Content: So this is maybe an old motel or apartment building and even though we didn't much care for the open air "feel" it was exactly what we needed. I traveled with a married couple to a wedding and the 2 separate bedrooms plus 2 separate bathrooms with small but full kitchen and living area was great. It is next to a hospital and I would imagine that most of their guests are family members of hospital patients. Our room was clean and we really had no complaints other than the open air, motel feel. Kendall is not far from the Miami airport which was great since we had an early morning flight the next day. We were only there to sleep and shower so we didn't spend a lot of time in our room. We were a bit leery of this place at first as we hadn't been able to find other reviews. It isn't 5 star by any means. I would compare the room quality to that of an older Holiday Inn Express. If you can get past the whole open air thing you will be fine. It was ideal for us with 2 separate bedrooms and 2 separate bathrooms. Like 2 hotel rooms for the price of one. We weren't familiar with this area of Miami either so I can't tell you what was nearby other than it wasn't a long drive to the airport. We just needed something near the airport and not much was available as it was the day prior to the Orange Bowl! I will say that the staff members I dealt with were all very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Oaktonoverland
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Kendall Hotel and Suites on and off for YEARS. For the money, it a good hotel. the rooms are large, clean and well acclimatized. Plenty of parking. Nice tennis courts, a swimming pool and exercise trails. If you have business at Miami Baptist Hospital, it can''t be beat. It is a bit isolated, so a car is necessary. If you want to see Miami before heading down to the keys, the Kendall is a nice point of attack. It's close to the turnpike and within 20 minutes of Coral Gables.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly wonderful”
Reviews.Author: tabrentals
Reviews.Content: Much nicer than I anticipated. Clean rooms, friendly staff and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Deceitfull hidden costs, rude, arrogant staff.”
Reviews.Author: paladinatlanta
Reviews.Content: When we made reservations, we were told a complimentary breakfast was included. AFTER we checked in, we find a letter in the room stating the complimentary breakfast was for only 2 people. There were 3 of us. We paid $13.00 for the extra person in the room, yet they demanded an additional $10.00 for breakfast for the third person. Autrice [-] at the front desk was arrogant and rude. They refused to honor the original reservation. WE WILL NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN!

HotelInfo.Name: Kendall Hotel and Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 9100 North Kendall Drive, Miami, FL 33176
